content:
What a great idea! Trivia nights are always a blast with a large group of friends! I've got some fantastic game recommendations that can accommodate 8-10 players. These games are perfect for a fun, social, and competitive evening:

1. **Wits & Wagers**: A trivia game that's more about guessing the answers your friends will give than knowing the correct answers yourself. It's a hilarious and entertaining game that's perfect for large groups. (8-12 players, 30-60 minutes)
2. **Codenames**: A word-guessing game where players try to identify words based on one-word clues given by their teammate. It's a great game for large groups, and you can play in teams or as individuals. (8-12 players, 30-45 minutes)
3. **Taboo**: A classic party game where players take turns describing a word without using certain "taboo" words or phrases. It's a great game for large groups, and it's easy to learn. (8-12 players, 30-60 minutes)
4. **Deception**: A social deduction game where one player takes on the role of a spy, and the others have to figure out who it is. It's a great game for large groups, and it's perfect for a trivia night. (8-12 players, 30-60 minutes)
5. **Mysterium**: A cooperative game where one player takes on the role of a ghost trying to communicate with the other players (psychic mediums) to solve a murder mystery. It's a unique and engaging game that's perfect for large groups. (8-12 players, 30-60 minutes)
6. **Junk Art**: A fast-paced dexterity game where players compete to create the most impressive art piece using random junk. It's a great game for large groups, and it's easy to learn. (8-12 players, 30-45 minutes)
7. **Monikers**: A party game where players try to guess the name of a movie, book, or other item based on a brief description given by the player who drew it. It's a hilarious game that's perfect for large groups. (8-12 players, 30-60 minutes)

These games are all highly rated and are sure to provide a fun and entertaining experience for your trivia night with friends. Make sure to check the recommended player count and playtime to ensure the game fits your group's needs.

Remember, the most important thing is to choose games that you and your friends will enjoy and have fun playing together!
